title: Tim Cocks
text:
Timothy Maxwell Delve Cocks (born 29 September 1952) is a former <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>n <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Playing career.
Cocks represented the Schools team at the 1970 annual <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> tournament. After school, Cocks played for the Natal under–20 team and thereafter for the Natal <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> side. In 1979, Cocks was in the <a href="South%20African%20Barbarians">South African Barbarians</a> side that toured to the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> under manager <a href="Chick%20Henderson%20%28rugby%20union%29">Chick Henderson</a>, alongside players such as <a href="Divan%20Serfontein">Divan Serfontein</a> and <a href="Errol%20Tobias">Errol Tobias</a>.
Cocks toured with the <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a> to <a href="1980%20South%20Africa%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20South%20America">South American</a> during October 1980. He did not play in any test matches on tour, but played in three tour matches, scoring two tries for the Springboks. On thirteen occasions he was selected on the replacement bench for the Springboks, but never made on to the field in a test match.
